5.5.8

% more 5.5_input_1ab.txt
ab

% more 5.5_input_2ab.txt
abab

% more 5.5_input_3ab.txt
ababab

% more 5.5_input_4ab.txt
abababab

% more 5.5_input_20ab.txt
abababababababababababababababababababab

% more 5.5_input_100ab.txt
abababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababababab

*** Run-length encoding ***

% java -cp algs4.jar:. RunLengthEncoding - < 5.5_input_1ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0000000100000010
0000010000000001
0000000100000010
0000001100000001
00000001
72 bits

0000000100000010

0000001000000010
0000010000000001
0000000100000010
0000001100000001
00000001

Compression ratio (as a function of N): (8 + 64N) / N = Approximately 6400%

*** Huffman encoding ***

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Huffman - < 5.5_input_1ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0101100001101100
0100000000000000
0000000000000000
01001000
56 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Huffman - < 5.5_input_2ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0101100001101100
0100000000000000
0000000000000000
10001010
56 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Huffman - < 5.5_input_3ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0101100001101100
0100000000000000
0000000000000000
1100101010000000
64 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Huffman - < 5.5_input_4ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0101100001101100
0100000000000000
0000000000000001
0000101010100000
64 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Huffman - < 5.5_input_20ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0101100001101100
0100000000000000
0000000000000101
0000101010101010
1010101010101010
1010101010100000
96 bits

Compression ratio (the relation [number of sequences : bits needed to encode] is variable, so for this exercise we base the compression ratio on N = 100).

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.Huffman - < 5.5_input_100ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 0
256 bits

Compression ratio: 256 / 100 = 256%

*** LZW encoding ***

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.LZW - < 5.5_input_1ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0000011000010000
0110001000010000
00000000
40 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.LZW - < 5.5_input_2ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0000011000010000
0110001000010000
0001000100000000
48 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.LZW - < 5.5_input_3ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0000011000010000
0110001000010000
0001000100000001
0001000000000000
64 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.LZW - < 5.5_input_4ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0000011000010000
0110001000010000
0001000100000011
0000011000100001
00000000
72 bits

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.LZW - < 5.5_input_20ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 16
0000011000010000
0110001000010000
0001000100000011
0001000000100001
0000010100010000
0100000100000111
0001000001100001
0000100100010000
1000000100000100
0001000000000000
160 bits

Compression ratio (the relation [number of sequences : bits needed to encode] is variable, so for this exercise we base the compression ratio on N = 100). 

% java -cp algs4.jar:. edu.princeton.cs.algs4.LZW - < 5.5_input_100ab.txt | java -cp algs4.jar:. BinaryDump 0
352 bits

Compression ratio: 352 / 100 = 352%
